DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare add effect TENS Supervised Motor Control Exercises ( SMCE ) Unsupervised Home Exercise Program ( UHEP ) disability , pain outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Are Supervised Exercises TENS Necessary Along With Prescribed Home Exercises Chronic Low Back Pain ?
DOC.detailed_description: Chronic low back pain ( CLBP ) common problem cause disability high economic burden globally well Nepal . There consensus treatment CLBP , however motor control exercise good evidence improvement pain disability CLBP population , whereas transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation ( TENS ) common treatment choice evidence . But , know supervise motor control exercise ( SMCE ) TENS add benefit home exercise program ( HEP ) commonly prescribe mode exercise . We plan conduct three arm randomize control trial answer question compare effect SMCE , TENS HEP versus SMCE HEP versus HEP alone disability pain two week six month follow . Three way-mixed model analysis Variance ( ANOVA ) use statistical test . Appropriate post hoc analysis do compare within group group difference .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Nonspecific Low back pain 3 month pain primarily localize T12 gluteal fold , patient report pain provoke relieved posture , movement activity . 2 . Age 18 65 year 3 . Male female 4 . All educational background ( educate uneducated ) 5 . Pain intensity 2/10 NPRS 6 . Disability 20/100 NODI 1 . Red flag note participant 's general medical screening questionnaire ( i.e . tumor , metabolic disease , Rheumatoid Arthritis , osteoporosis , prolonged history steroid use , etc . ) 2 . Signs consistent nerve root compression , include one following : 1 . Reproduction low back leg pain straight leg raise le 45 degree 2 . Muscle weakness involve major muscle group low extremity 3 . Diminished low extremity muscle stretch reflex ( Quadriceps Achilles tendon ) 4 . Diminished absent sensation pinprick low extremity dermatome 3 . Prior surgery lumbar spine buttock 4 . Current pregnancy 5 . Past medical history osteoporosis spinal compression fracture 6 . Participants provide inform consent study
